text: This is usually the first place we visit when we get to Chicago (and we often go several times since we don't have one at home). It's by far our favorite sandwich shop! The bread, as well as the other ingredients, is always super fresh, and the selection of sandwiches is perfect. And there's literally one on just about every corner, so it's easy to grab a great sammy whenever you want. We've been hoping to get Potbelly's in Atlanta for years! For now, we'll just have to keep making it our first stop whenever we visit the Windy City.

The wreck is pretty much the only sandwich I get here and the only reason is because there's no reason to try anything else lol. Seriously add some giardinera to This sandwich and your mouth will thank you !!!

Even though I frequent this mall I'd never been to this Potbelly location. Usually when I go to Potbelly I make a beeline for the sandwiches (Italian and Wreck sammies for life!). Last weekend, since I was in an intensive training and facing a time crunch, I opted for a strawberry smoothie. The smoothie was made to order lickety split and very refreshing. While still a fan of my beloved sandwiches, this experience has prompted me to branch out and try some of Potbelly's other offerings, including salads, more of the smoothies and, yes, even breakfast items.

I actually already contacted the Potbelly corporate offices about this I was so blown away by the awfulness of the sandwiches I just got from this Potbelly location. This afternoon, my boyfriend and I visited this Potbelly location for the first time and everything was fine until we began eating our sandwiches. I got a Turkey, he got a Big Italian with avocado on white with Provolone cheese, which he specifically asked for.   When I first bit into my sandwich I noticed a very very odd flavor from my sandwich, and after a couple of other bites, I realized it was from the pickles. The DID NOT taste like normal Potbelly pickles and almost tasted like they were soapy or they had gone bad. I had to take them off the sandwich in order to even continue eating the sandwich (which is really sad because they are my favorite part of the sandwich typically).   The sandwich was just so poorly made overall, there was literally no turkey or mustard on 1 side, just bread, onions, and lettuce. The other half of the sandwich was PACKED with turkey and was dripping mustard. It was just disappointing to have the sandwich be so inconsistent.  Unfortunately, my boyfriend's sandwich also was very poorly made. The avocado he received was practically rotten and should definitely not have been served to a customer. Secondly, the person making the sandwich put provolone cheese on one-half of the sandwich and SWISS cheese on the other half, without telling him or asking him if that was okay. Which was really unfortunate since he really does not swiss cheese and did not even order it. I really just couldn't believe the person making the sandwich thought that a customer wouldn't even notice that!

WHY do snooty people (see Cathie M below) get the best of everything? ;-)  Alfresco dining without the Chicago dust.  VENUE is clean and organized.  Speedy and Attentive STAFF even though it's quiet and chill.  Now that I am officially jealous of snooty people, I aspire to be ONE.  Can a broke ass Actor be snooty?  Lol  Maybe it's time to fish for a Sugar Daddy in this affordable quality sandwiches.

I love Potbelly's but this is probably the rudest staff I've experienced. The first couple of times I thought: Eh, maybe they're just having a bad day. But this is too consistent for excuses. I work in the neighborhood too, so I get that customers in this area can be shitty. But come on guys.
If I could give zero stars I would. Staff is rude and does not know how to properly make a sandwich. Extremely inconsistent.

I had the grilled chicken and cheddar cheese and the sandwich was excellent. What impressed me the most was how clean this Potbelly is. To many times I've gone to other Potbelly's and the tables are dirty with old wrappers and crumbs.

Ordered a basic turkey sandwich no cheese. They lady in front said it was hers put everything on it. Discovered it wasn't hers. I hate to wait maybe 1 minute! The manager? lady waiting on me apologized and gave me a free cookie for having to wait. It was nothing, it was the customers fault in front of me. The staff is so friendly and food fresh!! Great location.

Typical Potbelly atmosphere but a little less clean. Typical sandwich and moderately friendly employees. Never been to a store before that could only offer you one size of sandwich because they ran out of bread and then proceeded to charge us for the larger sandwiches. Nothing like paying $7 a piece for a mediocre sandwich for a 5 year old and then eating it on a sticky table. We won't be returning.
Moody folks, like they didn't know they worked in a high end mall with snooty people.  And yes, the fellow patrons were totally annoying!
Great service ,really clean place . I come here regularly . Friendly environment , not to much of a wait .

Where to start. The order taker yelling into my face at the gust behind me to get their order? The staff training or staffing in general - either a long line waiting to get your sandwich made while 2 cashiers stand there or sandwiches being made so fast that the 1 cashier cant keep up. They just can't seem to get it right... Be careful what toppings you get. If it comes out of a squeeze bottle you'll either get your sandwich soaked in it or none at all. Again, no happy medium. Sorry Potbelly, but this place gets an F.

This is the third time I go to this Potbelly at 6:30 pm and it is closed. Today I told them this establishment closes at 7 and they answered "no, we leave at 7 so we stop serving before that". In that case then have your hours be from 10-6:30. Simply annoying and disappointing.

I love potbellys but damn the people working at this one are all ignorant and brain damaged literally a bunch of invalids working here. They never get the order right and have no idea what customer service means and probably have no clue how to spell it. Honestly the only requirement to work here must be to have a pulse because every single one is more stupid than the next. Come on potbellys help a girl out and hire people with at least a drop of common sense and courtesy. Thanks

We stopped in after visiting the art institute. This location is right across the street and we were all hangry. I ordered an Uptown Salad and it was delicious.. so fresh and refreshing ;) The had a sandwiches, soups, wraps and flat breads.

Typical Potbelly.  20-minute wait for a toasted sub with a skimpy amount of fixings.  Their idea of extra tomatoes is to throw on an extra slice.  Actually, it was only a 15-minute wait.  Next time, I'll use their app to preorder.

This potbelly is a great location in the 900 shops. Tons of seating available . Quick service. I ordered something different which was the chicken salad sandwich I've had way better it was just very bland. Ill just stick with my usual from now on. I also ordered the pineapple coconut smoothie which was nothing like its advertised :( Tasted like  plain vanilla ice cream gross...
This is a great place for your usual sandwich and soup.  Their chicken tortilla soup is great paired with the macaroni salad. And don't forget a chocolate malt or dream bar!
I come here for my lunch breaks.. Service and food is always consistent! They get me in & out just in time to clock back in! I will always keep coming back!

My sandwich was fine, but the service there is REPULSIVE! The people were rude, impatient and apparently there is a specific order I need to keep when I describe my toppings, but I certainly know now.

I know that most Potbelly's are known for sandwiches, but this one makes incredible smoothies. It's a little bit of a hike to get up to the fifth floor, but my taste buds will have no other. Flashback, to July and 90 degree heat. I get to the counter and the guy tells me that I can create my own smoothie off the menu. I was in total heaven. Somehow he was able to mix all the berries into the drink that I requested. Totally quenched my thirst. I don't know if other locations offer the same deal but this place was worth the escalator ride.

This was my first Potbelly experience, and probably also my last.  I remember my Chicago friends in high school raving about this place, but I just wasn't that excited after my meal there this weekend. I ordered a roast beef sandwich and broccoli cheese soup.  The sandwich was forgettable and the soup was good in the way that everything is, when you add enough cheese.   The best part about this restaurant was the fact that, despite its location on the busiest part of Michigan Avenue, the lines were short and there was plenty of seating.  And free refills on fountain drinks.   If you just want some cheap lunch and a place to sit down, this Potbelly location definitely fits the bill.

We have been to several potbelly locations and they are very similar. I love their sandwiches, can you say TKY! For newcomers to this restaurant, it is certainly a little confusing. Why do they act like everyone in line knows everything that is happening. I wish sometimes the help would speak up and tell me more directly what they are asking. When I order a sandwich, it's more complicated than Subway if you wanted to be. The good food overcomes this challenge and I highly recommend potbelly sandwiches

Potbelly Sandwiches seem like they are everywhere in Chicago, so we happened to stop by one for a quick bite after the fantastic Chicago Architecture Foundation tour. The concept is very similar to the more nationally available Quizno's.  They take your sandwich ingredients, place in bread, and toast it so the whole thing is served warm.  Our sample: A Wreck Sandwich - made with salami, roast beef, turkey, and swiss cheese.  They have the ratio of ingredients down perfectly and the swiss cheese melts so well with the right amount of mayo and mustard.  This was a good sandwich. Raspberry Lemonade - was looking for something refreshing on the warm and humid day, but this was more like an overly sweetened Icee.  Very thick and hard to drink.  Once it melted, it was super sweet and I had to get several cups of ice water that did much better on the thirst quenching front. Overall, solid quick fast food lunch spot with good sandwiches.  Potbelly accepts credit cards, including American Express.

Come for a quick lunch before any services at Mario Tricoci.  They're very accommodating to your sandwich needs - since I don't like to have their sandwiches hot, they leave them cold for me. Love their variety of choices.

They have the nicest employees here. I don't expect great service at a fast food place but they were really cool especially since it was our first time here and we don't know the menu. The sandwiches are delicious and so was the chocolate brownie cookie. I'm craving one right now!

In the interest of full disclosure, I'm already a Potbelly's fan.  I feel that this Potbelly's is among my favorites.   The people who work here are incredibly nice, and have been more than accommodating (even by Potbelly's standards).  When walking in or around 900 N, this place is the place to get a quick sandwich.  Enough said.

Angela is fantastic!!! I submitted an order online for delivery right as their store was finishing up deliveries for the day. There was an issue with the driver, and all the other surrounding stores had stopped delivering. After asking me if I could change the order to a "pick-up" (which I couldn't because my car is in the shop), she made the extra effort and one of the employees who doesn't do deliveries brought it to me. This will definitely be my go-to Potbelly store because of their top-notch customer service! Thanks again!
Great lunch place that my daughter and I enjoyed on a busy shopping day. They claim that their handmade shakes are the best. They are!! Try the Banana one!

a new management or emplyees??? My experience today here was completely different. Usually i love love coming here. Ppl are nice and service is great. So today this place was not busy/which is a good thing for me/ but i am disappointed with the service. Actually the guys who got my order and made my sandwich was good. But the lady at the register... no no! She didn't greet to me, no smile/ no biggies / but i had to ask to go bag and bag my food myself/which never happened before/ top of that she didnt give me crackers for soup not even napkins!!! I was like ok?!?!?!... i work half block away from this location and i come here quite often for my lunch. But since today i try to bring my own lunch on wednesdays i guess.

A fancier looking Subway. Saw a lot of these all over downtown Chicago. I was inside the 900 shops and decided to grab a bite to eat here. It's located on the fifth floor. They serve sandwiches. I got the one with turkey with everything in it on wheat bread. It was toasted and had a lot of items in it. I like the flavoring the the wreck sandwich. It was a little more expensive than other sandwich places but it was good nonetheless. It's made really quick and I want some more.

so update: tried the NEW buffalo chiz sandwich that touted itself as being bold and spicy. Uh huh. what I got was a bland chix sandwich (blander than the regular huh?) that did not taste like it had any spice let alone a buffalo spice as named. Luckily they passed oubt these cute tiny free frank red-hot sauce bootless like part of some promotion I guess. anyway I doused it in that for any flavor and then it tasted like you know tobasco sauce right?  so that was okay I mena I liek tabasco suce LOL ps does anyone try these before offloading? huh?

We stopped in here for a lunch break from shopping. I have been to a few Potbellys in neighborhoods further north, and I was pleased to see that this Potbelly did not have outrageously jacked up prices considering the location.  All of the staff here were incredibly friendly, and the service was very quick. My usual, a turkey sandwich on wheat, hit the spot, just as I expected.

+ best sandwich chain in the US, + addicting überdelicious sandwiches, + inexpensive This is my praising hymn for 'Potbelly Sandwiches' and I hope this convinces them to open a branch in California! After traveling a lot through the country I have to say that Potbelly is for sure the best sandwich chain in the US! I love the way they toast the sandwiches including all meat and cheese and top it later with veggies and dressing or mayo. I really got addicted to 'A Wreck' that contains different cut meat and their 'Pizza Sandwich', which really tastes like pizza. Overall you can try all sandwiches no matter the ingredients since they all are überdelicious! Besides, you also get soups, salads, shakes and cookies at Potbelly, which are also very tasteful. + best sandwich chain in the US,  + addicting überdelicious sandwiches,  + inexpensive Original size: about $ 5 Big size: about $6

Locals rave about this place but it just seemed like another warm sandwich joint to me.  Why can't I get a half sandwich.  Service was short and rude and not helpful for someone coming in here the first time.

There are Pot Belly locations all over Chicago, and they all seemed crowded at lunch time, so I wanted to check it out.  It's a cute and cozy atmosphere, with a pleasant staff and decent (although a bit smaller than similar restaurants) menu.   One big draw back is they don't allow half sandwiches and soup - not cool!  I am petite, I can't eat an entire sandwich AND soup or a side.  I wanted a PB&J, and they made it, but on crusty bread - bit weird.  I would have preferred a soft bread for this sandwich...oh, well.  The chili was good.  Drink options are good. Overall, an A-OK experience, but it could be better...

Friendly atmosphere and QUICK service... I was in and out during the lunch hour.   I am a big fan of pot belly's to begin with, so there really isn't much to say--but that the sandwiches are delicious.  I did try the vegetable garden soup and it had a nice spicy kick to it.  I guess the only problem with this location is parking.

Just came here last night. Great location. Not too crowded at 5 pm. Extra friendly staff. If anybody thinks Chicagoans are unfriendly, they should check out this Potbelly's and they will be proven 100% wrong : )

Great location to get some lunch for a break from shopping. I had never been before but my sister raves about Potbelly's so I had to try it.  I had to smoked ham on their fresh regular bread and shared a chocolate milk shake and sugar cookie. Wow do I wish we had Potbelly's in San Francisco. It might just give the current favorite, Ike's, a run for their money.  The theme of the company is unique and their menu is perfect. Not too much but enough to not have a new favorite every time you go.

This Potbelly is in a very upscale mall anchored by Bloomingdales.  It has the regular Potbelly menu and prices; I went on a weekend and there was a guy playing a guitar in the corner, a nice touch.  And this location has seating right outside in the mall area.  Good all around.  Oh, and the mall itself has free wife in common areas.

This Potbellys is located on the fifth floor of the 900 N Michigan shops (the building just north of Water Tower Place with Bloomingdale's as the anchor store), and it's a great affordable eating option for anyone who doesn't want to spend a lot of money on lunch in the area. I like to stop here for the $6 skinny sandwich / soup combo after browsing in the Lululemon and JCrew on the lower floors. It's super clean, friendly, and not crowded.

Every trip through Chicago requires a stop at Potbelly!!!! My last stop it was 10am and I went for the same as always: turkey, swizz with seasoning and oil on wheat and don't forget the hot peppers! YUM! I love it because the bread get a quick toast, the cheese is perfectly melted and the entire sandwich is married together with oil, seasoning and the peppers. Last time I came through Chi-town I save half and ate it on my next lay over! Nothing beats it!
Always love Potbelly's. This is a nice clean one too. Staff is friendly.

I work across the street from this location so I come here pretty often (on days that I don't bring my own lunch). I have to say that I love, love, love Potbelly's. The first one I went to was on Taylor Street in Little Italy, but I come to this one a lot more often.  Potbelly's is the closest thing in Chicago to Santa Cruz's Joe's Pizzas and Subs. Joe's Pizzas and Subs was my favorite sandwich place back in Santa Cruz where I went to college -- I'd always order either the turkey sub or the pastrami sub. Here at Potbelly's, I'd either get the turkey or the wreck sandwich with "everything on it, easy on the peppers." (because these peppers are nothing like the peppers they put in at Joe's; they're a lot spicier).  I wish there were Potbelly's in California. I love the decor. The staff are always friendly, and you gotta admit, Potbelly's is a lot better than Subway or Quizno's -- those places can feel so cold sometimes.  Sometimes, they have their bad days... I hate it when the water taste like toilet water (or what I'd imagine toilet water to taste like because I've never actually had water from the toilet). Other times, their pickles taste a little funny to me as though it's been marinated for too long. But on most days, I feel like I'm in love. The toasted sandwiches brings me back to Santa Cruz and I fall in love all over again. And their vegetable garden soup is delicious and always steaming hot.  I do not recommend their salads though. Maybe it's just not my thing. Or maybe it's because their chicken salad salad isn't actually chicken... It tasted like tuna to me. o_O Or maybe it's because I don't like their croutons; they taste too much like slightly toasted bread rather than fully toasted and crispy bread as I imagine croutons should taste like. But if you must get a salad, I'd recommend the wreck salad.

I live like a half-mile from this location and I always forget it exists. But man, I love Potbelly.  The employees are always friendly and laid-back.  The food is consistently delicious and filling.  And the menu gets better all the time.  BIG sandwiches?  You're telling me I can get *more* of what I love?  Then I will love you more, Potbelly.  (The roast beef is a particular favorite.) The only downside to this location is that you'll have to go up to the 5th floor to get to it.  And the hours do suck.  Some of us like to eat after 7:30.  But Potbelly delivers consistent quality, and that cannot be denied.

Having first tried Potbelly's in DC almost a year ago, I couldn't stop thinking about the chain. When I discovered it was also available in Chicago I could not help myself but to get another one of "The Wreck" sandwiches here. It was RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET from where my friend lived--I was so jealous! Perfectly toasted crispy bread and good amounts of meat and toppings = a sandwich perfection. IF ONLY, IF ONLY, IF ONLY they would expand their chain over to the west coast (namely Californiaaaaa)! I guess it's probably better that this didn't happen because then I'd go nuts and not expand my food options anymore. Oh Potbelly's... how I miss you so!

I try not to eat Potbelly's more than once a week, but it is becoming very difficult! I first found out about it after I'd been in Chicago a few months, and thought it was pretty good. But eventually, I started realizing it was so much more flavorful than Subway and they have THE best oatmeal chocolate chip cookies ever. No matter what time of day you get one, they are soft and chewy and just really scrumptious. The dream bars are pretty good too, but not as big as the cookie. Eventually, I found out they have milkshakes too! Wow I need to just move next to one and I'd be happy forever.

I haven't tried the sandwiches but the salads are off the hook. I had the chicken salad salad and my husband had the Italian and oreo shake. Great deal with good food. I must agree that tables and chairs need to be wiped down more frequently but it wont stop us from returning.

I like the fact that I can shop and grab a bite of food here at the shopping center.  I heart the chicken salad sandwich and their potato salad.  It's good and it give me enough energy to keep shopping!

This Potbelly's has NEVER let me down.  As bad as I can feel ordering food when it's below 0 outside, the delivery peeps are super cool and friendly.  I order for delivery a lot from here.  Not once have I had a wrong order or a cold sandwich.  They really do have their shit together and I love that in a sammich shop!  The Wreck is my favorite and I cannot pass up their AppleBanana smoothies... even if it is going to be -30 degrees today!  I recommend this one (Sidenote: I've only been inside for p/u, I cannot vouch for cleanliness.)

I hate chains - this is one of those experiences that reminds me why I try to avoid them. the place was empty with the exception of a couple people eating at tables, including another employee who was just hanging out, sitting at one of the tables. I walk up and make my selection and, when asked if they could help me I tell the young lady (no name tag)  what I want - she says you have to order down here....and leads me to the other end of the counter where - I must have had an etcha-sketch conversation earlier....yes.  she made me say what I wanted, again, from the top.    WHAT?! I go back to the register to pay...yup - she's the same person who rings me up.  I'm thinking "what about my sandwich, where is it?"   The sandwich was good, I liked that it was heated.  However, service was poor.  Apparently, in this store, the only way you get friendly conversation / interaction, is to be one of the employees that work at that Potbelly's.  That's the only time they brightened up and showed any life / animation at all -  The table tops were dirty. One of the customers who came in after me had to ask to have his table cleaned. Yeah, I really liked the sandwich, but that's not enough to bring me back to poor service.  Boo PotBellys...BOO!

I ordered a chicken salad sandwich... specifically asking for it to be cold not hot b/c who eats hot chicken salad?  The order came hot, so I called and they had a cold sandwich here within 10 minutes.  Great service and very appreciated!   Will always order from this location.

Yeah I'm giving Potbelly's 4 stars...what of it? I love Potbelly's...take it or leave it. This one is located in the Bloomies building. Is that place a ghost town or what by the way? The building is almost scary to walk through and the people that are walking around in there are mostly employees. Sheesh.  Oh..I was reviewing Potbelly's that's right. So I had the ham and swiss with everything except oil and with light mayo. Mmm, mmm was that ever good. I mean what's not to like? It's a toasted sandwich for gods sake. They also sell my baked Lays. Yum. They're not only tasty but they're also waistline friendly. The sandwiches are pretty big so I only ate half of mine...but that just meant a little tasty treat for the hubby when I got home. ;) I love you Potbelly's...you're okay in my book.

We meandered here one lazy Saturday or Sunday afternoon for a beverage and found the place deserted. They have a mean banana smoothie though! I am not a huge fan of this shopping complex as the vibes are just all over the place with lego structures/sculptures (at least they had these still when I was there last) and then fantabulously expensive boutiques (and Nordstroms!) right next door.

I used to work here and I'll still eat the food every day. So good. The most filling sandwich in my opinion is the Meatball. It blows Subway's out of the water...and the meatballs are all beef. Everything is sliced and prepared fresh in the mornings (cookies included) and though you'll pay a bit more than you would at Subway, you'll walk away totally stuffed. And for the love of god, people, it's A WRECK! I can't tell you how many people call it by other names (Trainwreck, The works, etc).

I love love love the cookies here..especially the oatmeal chocolate chip! My favorite sandwich is the works sans salami! Yummy! This location in the mall seems to be busy no matter what time of day it is.  My only complaint is that they don't offer (or didn't when I was there) jalapeno chips!
